title: ‘You’ll lose BIG TIME!’ Sturgeon SKEWERED over 'irresponsible' Scot referendum bid
text:
‘You’ll lose BIG TIME!’ Sturgeon SKEWERED over 'irresponsible' Scot referendum bid ‘You’ll lose BIG TIME!’ Sturgeon SKEWERED over 'irresponsible' Scot referendum bid NICOLA Sturgeon was warned she was heading for a “big time” defeat after announcing plans for a second Scottish referendum on independence today. PUBLISHED: 11:59, Mon, Mar 13, 2017 | UPDATED: 13:48, Mon, Mar 13, 2017 
She said she owed it to Scottish people to give them a choice between a hard Brexit and independence - a decision that was panned across the political spectrum. 
Former Ukip leader Nigel Farage was first out of the blocks to condemn her decision to call for another Scottish referendum , warning Ms Sturgeon she faced a second humiliating defeat after the heavy 'No' victory in 2014. 
He Tweeted: “ Nicola Sturgeon would lose a second independence referendum big time.” Related articles Celtic nations hold CRUNCH Brexit meeting 
Ukip's Scottish MEP David Coburn described the prospect of a second referendum before spring 2019 as "utterly preposterous". 
"The UK will still be in negotiations with the EU at this time - the SNP seem to wish to cause maximum disruption, uncertainty and overall mayhem," said Mr Coburn. 
"In 2014 the Scottish people decided decisively to remain British, in 2016 less people voted to remain in the EU than voted to be British in 2014." 
Yesterday Scottish political veteran Jim Sillars described Mrs Sturgeon's actions as "irresponsibe". SKY Nicola Sturgeon announced plans for a second Scottish referendum today 
He said: "Yes cannot afford to lose again, and lose we shall if the timing is wrong. 
“The rhetoric and hype from Nicola Sturgeon since the EU referendum has been irresponsible." 
BBC presenter Andrew Neil immediately picked apart Ms Sturgeon’s argument that she had a clear mandate to call for a second vote - as well as highlighting her lack of real plan for the future of the country. 
He said: “Sturgeon unable to answer if indyref2 means Scotland stays in EU or seamlessly re-enters. 
“Sturgeon/SNP used to say only indyref2 if clear will of Scottish people. No indication it is.” She is stabbing England in the back and betraying many of her fellow Scots by trying to derail Brexit Eddie Bone, Campaign for English Parliament 
Eddie Bone of the Campaign for an English Parliament accused Ms Sturgeon of having a “lust” for independence. 
He said: “In her lust for Scottish independence, Nicola Sturgeon ignored that England and Scotland, although having a history of conflict, have for over 300 years worked peacefully together. 
“Instead of working with the UK government and the people of England she continues to go to Brussels in an attempt to ‘curry favour’ with the EU at England’s expense. 
"She is stabbing England in the back and betraying many of her fellow Scots by trying to derail Brexit.” All the best pictures from the Scotland Referendum Sun, March 5, 2017 More than 3.6m people turned out to vote in the Scottish independent referendum, resulting in a 'No' vote with 55.3%.Here we take a look at the public's reaction. AFP/Getty 1 of 52 Pro-Independence supporters are pictured in Edinburgh, Scotland, on September 19, 2014, as referendum results are announced. Scotland appeared set to reject independence on Friday with 23 out of 32 voting areas declared and the crucial Glasgow region having given its result 
Scottish Conservative leader Ruth Davidson accused the First Minister of leading the country towards “division and uncertainty”. 
She said: “Nicola Sturgeon has today chosen the path of further division and uncertainty. We will vote against any request for a Section 30 next week.” 
Scottish Labour leader Kezia Dugdale has also criticised the decision, saying the country would only become more divided. GETTY A second Scottish referendum has been called by Nicola Sturgeon 
She said: "Scotland is already divided enough. We do not want to be divided again, but that is exactly what another independence referendum would do." 
Ms Dugdale added leaving the UK would "turbo-charge" austerity in the country. GETTY Ruth Davidson accused Ms Sturgeon of leading Scotland towards 'division' 
Even the Lib Dems, the only party to call for a second EU referendum, said it would oppose a second vote in Scotland. 
And the EU itself indicated it would not bend over backwards to help Scotland - hinting it would be required to re-apply to join the EU as an independent state, as laid out in the Barroso docrine. 
European Commission spokesman Margaritis Schinas said today: "The Barroso doctrine, would that apply? Yes that would apply, obviously." Related articles
